III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS & CONCLUSIONS
A. Physical Description of Facility
Genesee County Juvenile Justice Center (GCJJC) is located in Flint Township,
Michigan. The facility is a secure building consists of a two-story comprised of the
personnel and administrative offices; intake unit; medical unit; kitchen, two dining rooms
and two gymnasiums. The resident’s records are kept in the administrative section of
the building in a secure file. An ample supply of desks, office furniture and other office
equipment exist to meet the staff’s needs. Emergency exits and equipment is also
visible in the building.
The residents are housed in the portion of building that consists of four resident wings
(North, South, East West). Three wings are in operational status, while the third (South)
is not currently in use to house youths. Each wing has a group/ TV/activity room, lockers
and storage area for the youths, bathroom and shower area and staff outer area. The
East wing has occupancy for XX youths; West wing XX youth; North wing XX youths;
South wing XX if it was in use. Each of this resident wing has single and double
occupant rooms. The facility has a secure area for medication storage on each wing.
The classrooms, which contains desks, computers, and an ample supply of equipment
to meet the resident’s needs are between the east and west wings on a separate
corridor. There also XX visitation rooms equipped with monitor, camera, and seating to
accommodate parent/child visitations.
2

There is ample parking for staff and visitors; and the facility has a fenced outside
recreation area.
B. Program Description
Genesee County Juvenile Justice Center (GCJJC) is a secure juvenile detention center
operated under the 7th Judicial Circuit Court. GCJJC purpose centers on supporting
justice and public safety by providing short term programming for youth court ordered into
juvenile detention pending the court’s disposition of the youth’s case. The facility is a 72-
bed facility designed to provide both short-term residential care to youth between the ages
of 10 to 18 years who have been arrested for law violations. The youths are retained at
the facility pending adjudication of his/her offenses. The youth can continue at GCJJC
until a long-term treatment program, release to a parent/guardian, appropriate continuum
of care is identified in the community, or escalation to more restrictive setting is court
order and or identified for the youth.
GCJJC is the transformed Genesee Valley Regional Center (GVRC) juvenile detention
facility which found its start in 1957 when it became apparent that Genesee County
needed to lodge youth in a more secure setting. With the increase in cost, Genesee
County sold the facility to the State of Michigan for operation by the Department. In
2002, the State of Michigan turned the facility back over to Genesee County as an
independent county ran Child Caring Institution (CCI). The center director was an
appointed position of the Genesee County Board of Commissioners and answered to
the commissioners about operation and budgetary regulations. In the fall of 2019, the
Genesee County Commissioners voted that the operation and budget would be turned
over to the Genesee County 7th Judicial Circuit Court for management.
GCJJC will provide youth placed in the facility with an initial health screening; medical,
mental health, educational services, and other professional services, which is contracted
via various community sources. GCJJC is located in the Flushing School District, but the
facility has contracted for educational services from Mt. Morris School District. The school
program is fully accredited and taught by Special Education Certified teachers from the
Mount Morris School District. The teachers have experience working with delinquent
youth. The current contract is in effect until September 30, 2021, after which time a new
contract will be negotiated.
GCJJC as developed via GVRC will use peer group support as a component of the
behavior management program. Programming will also include daily recreation, daily
group counseling, individual counseling as needed. The staff utilize Core Correctional
Practices (CCP) and CHOICES; two cognitive-behavioral models, developed by the
University of Cincinnati Corrections Institute (UCCI), that places heavy emphasis on skill
building activities to assist with a youths cognitive, social, emotional, and coping skill
development.
3

Single occupant sleeping rooms are approved as behavior management rooms. Handle
with care is the discipline/Behavioral Management Modality utilized, with accent on verbal
escalation and role modeling.

There are no rule violations.

The issuance of an original license for a court operated facility is recommended.
